{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Key Account Manager",
  "description": "Paga is a licensed financial services company and a leading payments company in Nigeria with a massive transformative purpose - to make it simple for one billion people to access and use money. It was founded on the simple belief that the ubiquity of mobile phones can be leveraged in building an ecosystem that enables people to digitally send and receive money and creating simple financial access for everyone.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Key Account Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Yaba, Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time
Sector: Trade and Commerce
Reports To: Sales Manager

About the Role


	The Account Manager will be responsible for bringing onboard high net worth sellers, merchants, and SME businesses on Doroki and driving activities to deliver on set targets.
	The main goal is to acquire new small and medium scale Merchants/Sellers/Businesses and manage relationships with existing ones.
	To be successful you will need to be comfortable spending significant time in the field with merchants and businesses and working with them to exceed set targets.
	You must be someone with a strong ability to influence and work collaboratively across teams.


Responsibilities


	Achieve commercial targets - the account manager has the ownership of achieving the overall commercial targets set for the territory of coverage. The targets include but are not limited to active merchant recruitment, merchant retention and revenue.
	Proactively acquire new FMCG merchants and deepen existing relationships, by building a healthy pipeline of prospects using approved sales CRM tools.
	Develop a solid and trusting relationship between major key businesses and the company
	Regular virtual meetings with small and medium scale businesses or sales visits to demonstrate and present Doroki product offerings.
	Develop in-store visibility plans for Doroki in collaboration with SME merchants&rsquo; management; and follow up to achieve timely &amp; effective implementation.
	Resolving key client issues and complaints
	Strategic planning to improve client results
	Negotiating contracts with the client and establishing a timeline of performance
	Expand relationships and bringing in new clients
	Manage merchants&rsquo; expectations, adhere to company policies, procedures &amp; controls, and ensure compliance with rules &amp; regulations
	Analyze &amp; monitor merchant operations and channel trends to be able to make recommendations on business and service enhancements
	Work with support teams to ensure that SME businesses get adequate support and proper communication to drive satisfaction and usage
	Conduct regular spot checks on merchant activities and share feedback with the team
	Identify emerging markets and market shifts while being fully aware of new products and competition status
	Analyze data using available tools/dashboard
	Understand, utilise, and support the service architecture created for the support of Key Doroki merchants
	Give timely updates or gather market intelligence on Doroki service efficiency and effectiveness and channel issues and concerns to the appropriate unit
	Pilot new services initiatives for key Doroki merchants and provide feedback for enhancements
	Identifies service enhancements/service improvements, document them and discuss them with the line manager
	Conduct periodic surveys on merchants for service improvement
	Use trends to engage proactively, and support key merchant business by introducing new ways to optimize channels.
	Generates and reports daily/ weekly key merchant Performance to the line manager
	Work with the marketing team and line manager, to ensure proper branding support is delivered to key merchants on time.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree from an accredited university or college
	At least 5 years of relevant experience in B2B sales
	Problem solving skills
	Previous experience working in the FMCG or Service industry
	Must be able to work in a high-velocity, high performance environment
	Must be able to develop and communicate competitive landscape analysis
	Proficient in the use of sales CRM tools
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Provide outstanding customer service.


Key Competencies:


	Strong leadership
	Strong interpersonal/communication skills
	Takes initiative and ownership
	Company and Customer expertise
	Skilled negotiator
	Value based selling
	Strong ability to motivate, influence and advice people
	Strong planning and organizational skills
	Attention to detail
	Ability to multi-task and manage competing priorities
	Good judgement and decision-making ability
	Excellent communication skills &ndash; verbal, non-verbal and written
	Strategic thinking skills
	Problem solving skills.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-19",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-20",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Paga Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "187653"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Key Account Manager Job at Paga Limited




        
    

        
        Paga is a licensed financial services company and a leading payments company in Nigeria with a massive transformative purpose - to make it simple for one billion people to access and use money. It was founded on the simple belief that the ubiquity of mobile phones can be leveraged in building an ecosystem that enables people to digitally send and receive money and creating simple financial access for everyone.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Key Account Manager

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time
Sector: Trade and Commerce
Reports To: Sales Manager

About the Role
     

            
    




	The Account Manager will be responsible for bringing onboard high net worth sellers, merchants, and SME businesses on Doroki and driving activities to deliver on set targets.
	The main goal is to acquire new small and medium scale Merchants/Sellers/Businesses and manage relationships with existing ones.
	To be successful you will need to be comfortable spending significant time in the field with merchants and businesses and working with them to exceed set targets.
	You must be someone with a strong ability to influence and work collaboratively across teams.


Responsibilities


	Achieve commercial targets - the account manager has the ownership of achieving the overall commercial targets set for the territory of coverage. The targets include but are not limited to active merchant recruitment, merchant retention and revenue.
	Proactively acquire new FMCG merchants and deepen existing relationships, by building a healthy pipeline of prospects using approved sales CRM tools.
	Develop a solid and trusting relationship between major key businesses and the company
	Regular virtual meetings with small and medium scale businesses or sales visits to demonstrate and present Doroki product offerings.
	Develop in-store visibility plans for Doroki in collaboration with SME merchants’ management; and follow up to achieve timely & effective implementation.
	Resolving key client issues and complaints
	Strategic planning to improve client results
	Negotiating contracts with the client and establishing a timeline of performance
	Expand relationships and bringing in new clients
	Manage merchants’ expectations, adhere to company policies, procedures & controls, and ensure compliance with rules & regulations
	Analyze & monitor merchant operations and channel trends to be able to make recommendations on business and service enhancements
	Work with support teams to ensure that SME businesses get adequate support and proper communication to drive satisfaction and usage
	Conduct regular spot checks on merchant activities and share feedback with the team
	Identify emerging markets and market shifts while being fully aware of new products and competition status
	Analyze data using available tools/dashboard
	Understand, utilise, and support the service architecture created for the support of Key Doroki merchants
	Give timely updates or gather market intelligence on Doroki service efficiency and effectiveness and channel issues and concerns to the appropriate unit
	Pilot new services initiatives for key Doroki merchants and provide feedback for enhancements
	Identifies service enhancements/service improvements, document them and discuss them with the line manager
	Conduct periodic surveys on merchants for service improvement
	Use trends to engage proactively, and support key merchant business by introducing new ways to optimize channels.
	Generates and reports daily/ weekly key merchant Performance to the line manager
	Work with the marketing team and line manager, to ensure proper branding support is delivered to key merchants on time.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university or college
	At least 5 years of relevant experience in B2B sales
	Problem solving skills
	Previous experience working in the FMCG or Service industry
	Must be able to work in a high-velocity, high performance environment
	Must be able to develop and communicate competitive landscape analysis
	Proficient in the use of sales CRM tools
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Provide outstanding customer service.


Key Competencies:


	Strong leadership
	Strong interpersonal/communication skills
	Takes initiative and ownership
	Company and Customer expertise
	Skilled negotiator
	Value based selling
	Strong ability to motivate, influence and advice people
	Strong planning and organizational skills
	Attention to detail
	Ability to multi-task and manage competing priorities
	Good judgement and decision-making ability
	Excellent communication skills – verbal, non-verbal and written
	Strategic thinking skills
	Problem solving skills.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sonographer / Radiographer",
  "description": "Zael consulting is basically a recruitment firm. We offer clients and candidates the confidence of specialist recruiters the have the depth and breath of experience across key sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sonographer / Radiographer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Operate X-ray, CT, MRI, ultrasound, or other imaging equipment as required.
	Prepare and position patients for imaging procedures.
	Ensure adherence to radiation safety protocols.
	Review and evaluate images for quality before submitting to physicians.
	Maintain accurate patient records and reports.
	Provide compassionate care and explain procedures to patients.
	Collaborate with doctors and other healthcare professionals to ensure accurate diagnoses.
	Maintain and calibrate imaging equipment to ensure functionality.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Radiography
	Current license/registration with relevant regulatory body.
	Proven experience as a Radiographer in a clinical setting.
	Strong technical knowledge of imaging equipment and safety protocols.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Attention to detail and ability to work under pressure.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;info@zaelconsulting.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Zael Business Management & Consulting"

Sonographer / Radiographer Job at Zael Business Management & Consulting




        
    

        
        Zael consulting is basically a recruitment firm. We offer clients and candidates the confidence of specialist recruiters the have the depth and breath of experience across key sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sonographer / Radiographer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Operate X-ray, CT, MRI, ultrasound, or other imaging equipment as required.
	Prepare and position patients for imaging procedures.
	Ensure adherence to radiation safety protocols.
	Review and evaluate images for quality before submitting to physicians.
	Maintain accurate patient records and reports.
	Provide compassionate care and explain procedures to patients.
	Collaborate with doctors and other healthcare professionals to ensure accurate diagnoses.
	Maintain and calibrate imaging equipment to ensure functionality.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Radiography
	Current license/registration with relevant regulatory body.
	Proven experience as a Radiographer in a clinical setting.
	Strong technical knowledge of imaging equipment and safety protocols.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Attention to detail and ability to work under pressure.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: info@zaelconsulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

&lsquo;Impossibility is Nothing&rsquo;.

PIL was conceived in 2007, as regards to its incorporation and duly registered in 2013 with Corporate Affairs Commission of Nigeria (CAC) with Registration Number RC 1097861. It originated in response to providing world class services and solutions to the society at large and offering an alternative that is satisfactory in areas of our specialty. It has carried out service rendering duties in various states of Nigeria and within the ever bustling business environment of Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Health

Job brief


	We are seeking a proactive and results-driven Business Development Executive to drive growth, build relationships, and expand the company&rsquo;s client base.
	The role involves identifying new business opportunities, developing and maintaining client relationships, and promoting the company&rsquo;s products and services to achieve set targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, develop, and secure new business opportunities across assigned markets.
	Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with clients, partners, and stakeholders.
	Conduct market research to identify trends, competitor activities, and customer needs.
	Develop and deliver compelling business proposals, presentations, and pitches.
	Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless delivery of products and services.
	Achieve sales targets, monitor performance, and provide regular reports to management.
	Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and networking opportunities.
	Provide feedback from clients and the market to support product and service development.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of solid Proven experience as a Business Development Executive, Sales Executive, in the Health sector.
	Strong negotiation, presentation, and communication skills.
	Ability to build and maintain strong professional relationships.
	Goal-oriented with a track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.
	Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work independently with minimal supervision.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM tools is an added advantage.
	Not more than 28years of age.


Salary
N150,000 monthly + Commission.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;jobpruvia@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Business Development Executive Job at Pruvia Integrated Limited




        
    

        
        Pruvia Integrated Limited, we are general service merchants with a strong desire to ensure customer satisfaction in the midst of efficient and effective service delivery. As an organization we are driven by the dictum of
‘Impossibility is Nothing’.

PIL was conceived in 2007, as regards to its incorporation and duly registered in 2013 with Corporate Affairs Commission of Nigeria (CAC) with Registration Number RC 1097861. It originated in response to providing world class services and solutions to the society at large and offering an alternative that is satisfactory in areas of our specialty. It has carried out service rendering duties in various states of Nigeria and within the ever bustling business environment of Lagos.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Health

Job brief


	We are seeking a proactive and results-driven Business Development Executive to drive growth, build relationships, and expand the company’s client base.
	The role involves identifying new business opportunities, developing and maintaining client relationships, and promoting the company’s products and services to achieve set targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, develop, and secure new business opportunities across assigned markets.
	Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with clients, partners, and stakeholders.
	Conduct market research to identify trends, competitor activities, and customer needs.
	Develop and deliver compelling business proposals, presentations, and pitches.
	Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless delivery of products and services.
	Achieve sales targets, monitor performance, and provide regular reports to management.
	Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and networking opportunities.
	Provide feedback from clients and the market to support product and service development.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of solid Proven experience as a Business Development Executive, Sales Executive, in the Health sector.
	Strong negotiation, presentation, and communication skills.
	Ability to build and maintain strong professional relationships.
	Goal-oriented with a track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.
	Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work independently with minimal supervision.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM tools is an added advantage.
	Not more than 28years of age.


Salary
N150,000 monthly + Commission.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobpruvia@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front Desk Officer",
  "description": "Mitera Health Limited (RC 1190295) is a technology-driven healthcare organization. We provide flexible, affordable and accessible health insurance plans to meet the needs of Nigerians with guaranteed access to qualitative healthcare.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Front Desk Officer is the first point of contact for members, visitors, and partners at Mitera Health HMO.
	This role is crucial for creating a positive and welcoming environment, efficiently managing inquiries, and providing administrative support.
	The ideal candidate is highly organized, possesses excellent communication skills, and is dedicated to delivering outstanding customer service in a fast-paced healthcare environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Warmly greet and welcome all members, visitors, and vendors, providing assistance and directing them appropriately.
	Manage incoming calls, directing them to the relevant departments or personnel.
	Schedule appointments and meetings for various departments, ensuring efficient t ime management.
	Maintain a tidy, organized, and professional reception area.
	Handle incoming and outgoing correspondence, including mail, packages, and deliveries.
	Process basic member inquiries regarding services, appointments, or general information, escalating complex issues to appropriate teams.
	Maintain accurate visitor logs and ensure security protocols are followed.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree or HND in Business Administration, Office Management, or a related field.
	Proven experience (1-3 years) in a front desk, reception, or administrative support role, preferably within a healthcare or HMO setting.
	Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).
	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities with a keen eye for detail.
	Professional demeanor and appearance.
	Ability to handle difficult situations with tact and empathy. &bull; Knowledge of basic office procedures and equipment


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover letter to:&nbsp;joboffer@miterahealth.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-07",

  },

Front Desk Officer Job at Mitera Health Limited




        
    

        
        Mitera Health Limited (RC 1190295) is a technology-driven healthcare organization. We provide flexible, affordable and accessible health insurance plans to meet the needs of Nigerians with guaranteed access to qualitative healthcare.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Front Desk Officer is the first point of contact for members, visitors, and partners at Mitera Health HMO.
	This role is crucial for creating a positive and welcoming environment, efficiently managing inquiries, and providing administrative support.
	The ideal candidate is highly organized, possesses excellent communication skills, and is dedicated to delivering outstanding customer service in a fast-paced healthcare environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Warmly greet and welcome all members, visitors, and vendors, providing assistance and directing them appropriately.
	Manage incoming calls, directing them to the relevant departments or personnel.
	Schedule appointments and meetings for various departments, ensuring efficient t ime management.
	Maintain a tidy, organized, and professional reception area.
	Handle incoming and outgoing correspondence, including mail, packages, and deliveries.
	Process basic member inquiries regarding services, appointments, or general information, escalating complex issues to appropriate teams.
	Maintain accurate visitor logs and ensure security protocols are followed.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor's Degree or HND in Business Administration, Office Management, or a related field.
	Proven experience (1-3 years) in a front desk, reception, or administrative support role, preferably within a healthcare or HMO setting.
	Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).
	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities with a keen eye for detail.
	Professional demeanor and appearance.
	Ability to handle difficult situations with tact and empathy. • Knowledge of basic office procedures and equipment


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover letter to: joboffer@miterahealth.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Marketing Manager",
  "description": "Shawsand Medical Centre is a world-class medical facility located in Port Harcourt. We have different medical equipment that aids us in treating our patients and various surgical procedures. Our staff are highly trained and dedicated towards their work. We are computerized and this makes the jobeasier. It also ensures continuity. We at Shawsand Medical Centre have chosen to adopt this model of patient care in Nigeria in our areas of focus, utilizing the state-of-the-artequipment in our facility and local, national, and international expertise that is available to provide solutions to our patients&#39; problems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time
Duration:&nbsp;6-Month Contract

Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement marketing strategies to secure partnerships with corporate organizations and Health Maintenance Organizations (HMOs).
	Drive client acquisition and build long-term business relationships for hospital services.
	Conduct market research to identify new opportunities and business leads.
	Prepare and deliver compelling proposals and presentations to prospective clients.
	Manage end-to-end business development activities, from lead generation to contract signing.
	Monitor and report on marketing and client acquisition performance.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an OND, HND, or Bachelor&#39;s Degree with&nbsp;3-5 years of relevant experience.
	Proven experience in healthcare marketing, preferably with hospitals or HMOs.
	Strong network and track record of securing corporate and HMO partnerships.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and presentation skills.
	Ability to work independently and deliver measurable results within a short timeframe.


What We Offer


	N50,000 - N150,000 / Month
	Opportunity to make a direct impact in expanding our hospital&rsquo;s corporate client base.
	Dynamic and professional work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to:&nbsp;Info@shawsandmedical.com&nbsp;using &quot;Application &ndash; Marketing Manager (6-Month Contract)&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Marketing Manager Job at Shawsand Medical Centre




        
    

        
        Shawsand Medical Centre is a world-class medical facility located in Port Harcourt. We have different medical equipment that aids us in treating our patients and various surgical procedures. Our staff are highly trained and dedicated towards their work. We are computerized and this makes the jobeasier. It also ensures continuity. We at Shawsand Medical Centre have chosen to adopt this model of patient care in Nigeria in our areas of focus, utilizing the state-of-the-artequipment in our facility and local, national, and international expertise that is available to provide solutions to our patients' problems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time
Duration: 6-Month Contract

Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement marketing strategies to secure partnerships with corporate organizations and Health Maintenance Organizations (HMOs).
	Drive client acquisition and build long-term business relationships for hospital services.
	Conduct market research to identify new opportunities and business leads.
	Prepare and deliver compelling proposals and presentations to prospective clients.
	Manage end-to-end business development activities, from lead generation to contract signing.
	Monitor and report on marketing and client acquisition performance.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an OND, HND, or Bachelor's Degree with 3-5 years of relevant experience.
	Proven experience in healthcare marketing, preferably with hospitals or HMOs.
	Strong network and track record of securing corporate and HMO partnerships.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and presentation skills.
	Ability to work independently and deliver measurable results within a short timeframe.


What We Offer


	N50,000 - N150,000 / Month
	Opportunity to make a direct impact in expanding our hospital’s corporate client base.
	Dynamic and professional work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: Info@shawsandmedical.com using "Application – Marketing Manager (6-Month Contract)" as the subject of the email.
